intro: Hieracium muricatum, commonly known as the rough hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. Its leaves are rough and hairy, and the flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disc. Hieracium muricatum is often found in open habitats and can spread readily through its rhizomes.
